Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the book mentioned in the Facebook post is not part of South Africa's sex education curriculum.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the content of the book by implying that it will be taught to grade 4 students in 2020 when there is no evidence to support this.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as there is no evidence provided to verify the accuracy of the Facebook post.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the Facebook post accurately represents South Africa's sex education curriculum without verifying its authenticity.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation that the Facebook post and images are misleading or outdated, as stated by the Department of Basic Education and the fact that the book is no longer available for purchase.
